reviews.sentence: The staff was great and friendlyNo coffee in the lobby no whirlpool in a hotel.

good choice with some downfalls. check in was quick and there were warm cookies waiting for us. The rooms were comfortable especially the beds. The internet was 10 a day and we were supposed to have free breakfast which ended up on our room charges and they hit us with some bar charges as well which we never used anything from. They were good about taking it off at checkout but it felt like we were nickel and dimed the entire time. The staff was very friendly but DO NOT take pictures in the lobby you will get yourself into trouble with security even if its pictures of friends. I gave this hotel an average rating because I did not feel at home. But it is in a great location and I would stay here again especially considering the price deal we got.

Very disappointed I recently stayed at this hotel for a business conference and was very disappointed in my stay. The only reason for the second star was its physical location to lots of other things to see and do while in Chicago. My room was large and spacious but there was a lot of mildew growing in the shower and the sink had a drip that never stopped which wasquite annoying. The mattress was so hard I opted to sleep on the couch. All that for about 300 night. For this price you also have to pay more for Internet service in your room. They have a great workout facility but it costs 15 day or 25 week. There were charged for everything and it gets tiring being nickeled and dined to death. If you are going to charge like a first class hotel you better provide first class services. I can get free Wi Fi use of the workout facilities and a free breakfast at lots of hotels for a fraction of this price.

Lacking Amenities. Nice room good location but lacking amenities. We had to pay for wifi pay full price for parking 50 day there was no refrigerator or microwave in the room and the restaurant was only open for breakfast. I usually expect more when traveling for leisure.
Good location and facilities. Location good for Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier. Require to pay for wi fi access in room. Free access only available in public area.

Unexpectedly perfect. 3 friends celebrating a 20 year friendship meet in Chicago. The location is perfect. Walking distance to Magnificent Mile Milenium Park The Pier and great restaurants. The front desk staff are attentive and very friendly. Room was spotless reasonable amenities. The warm cookies at check in are such a great touch. Good public space restaurant and breakfast spot and the lobby bar is a busy place. We used Uber to go to Oak Park to see the Frank Lloyd Wright homes. About 20. We could walk to the river to do the architecture cruise. Fantastic trip. I would definitely stay here again.
Great location comfortable accommodation and clean environment. Obviously the location not only for access to downtown Chicago but also because of its proximity to my locally resident relatives.

Friendly staff Great location. I stayed at this DoubleTree location the first two days of September because I was in town for an appointment at the French Consulate. The staff was amazing greeting us with friendly faces and fresh baked cookies after a long hot bus ride to Chicago. While I do not remember the name of the gentleman who checked us in he definitely made our stay wonderful. The room on the 24th floor was clean spacious and had a great view. The rooftop pool was a nice amenity as well. The DoubleTree was in the perfect location just two short blocks from the Magnificent Mile great food a cozy cafe for an early morning espresso and a short walk to the Consulate as well. We will be back next time we visit Chicago.

Parking here is pricey as they do not validate for guests. However the rate is an amazing deal given the location. So I suppose it all balances out. Oh they also have an Einstein Bagel in the lobby so that is pretty great.

First staying in downtown Chicago. Staying at the DoubleTree on the Magnificent Mile was very nice and safe. Room was clean and comfortable with all the amenities of home. Conference facilities were more than adequate. Not to warm not to cold. Location was conveniently located to some great restaurants and bars. Would stay here again anytime.

Check out internet. No sign on door to keep housekeeping away Came to door a 8 am told them we are leaving a noon. Went down to lobby and when we returned they were in our room. When ask to get back in our room they said no. Ask several more time and they put us in a room that was not cleaned yet. did not like that at all. That room guest could have returned just like us at anytime. When I went to the desk in the lobby. They said sorry. wow Thanks.

Worth the View. This downtown hotel is family friendly and has a great location. It is located on Ohio Street and is walking distance to the Navy Pier and the Mag Mile. The roof top pool on the 5th floor is a fun experience too. We are from a small town so swimming surrounded by skyscrapers was so fun. There is a pool bar as well but we noticed other families brought their own personal coolers with drinks. Great idea as this did not seem to be an issue for the staff and of course much cheaper. There is a grocery store right next door to the hotel so drinks and snacks can be bought there. We drove so we parked our car at the hotel for an extra 55. Yikes. We did notice that there is a parkade next door that was much cheaper. Worth checking into. As for our room. Great beds air conditioning lots of space and a window bench to take in the view. We were in the 19th floor so what a view we had. There is a snack tray from hotel so be sure that children do not touch it or you will pay an enormous amount for your snack. The same goes for the stacked mini fridge. There is a coffee maker but no mini fridge or microwave. There is a bar and coffee shop in the lobby. Oh and chocolate chip cookies at Checkin.

Overly crowded hotel for the price. This hotel is not only overly populated but it also has no valet and their parking garage is the worse garage I have ever had to park my car. The elevator locations alone are a hassle you are drenching in sweat from no a c and the the elevator takes 15 minutes. People were seriously thinking it was broken but we had so many things to carry we had no choice but to wait. The lobby was so congested there was a huge line and all the elevators in the lobby were jam packed. The only decent thing about this hotel is that the room was decent and the room service pretty fast. I will never go back here. I paid 360 dollars for a 2 Queen sized bed room. The decor in the hallways are totally outdated and the walls were painted green. And let us not even start on the rugs in the hallways to the rooms. Totally not worth the money. There are hotels twice as nice for that amount of money in downtown.

The Doubletree Magnificent Mile Chicago. I reserved three rooms for this trip to downtown Chicago. I have stayed at this hotel before. The hotel staff are very accommodating. We were able to check in early to our room before noon. Although the rooms are equipped with a beverage stocked mini refrigerator I requested a refrigerator for one of my rooms. In the past there has been a charge for this. It provided was complimentary this weekend. The rooms were clean and adequately furnished however the furniture is starting to show its age. There were plenty of towels etc. provided. I needed late check out and was given 1 hour extension to 1 pm. There is a small lobby with a bar but I have never seen the bar open in any of my stays. Doubletree gives a chocolate chip cookie at check in but there is no complimentary breakfast or coffee in the lobby. There is a two cup coffee machine in the rooms. One evening we wanted a cocktail before bed and went into the adjoining restaurant bar. It looked like it needed a facelift. Drinks were quite pricey for the atmosphere etc 2450 for a vodka and cranberry and a glass of house red wine. Live and learn on that. The hotel also has a shuttle service for a fee. It was handy because we had a party of 6 and we all could ride together. Planning to return to the Doubletree in another month. Price location clean rooms friendly staff Everything is nearby with a short walk or cab UBER ride. Open the bar in the lobby. Offer some free coffee in the lobby. Update furniture in the rooms.

Loud. I will not be back. I did not experience breakfast or the gym because my sleep stuck. First my room request procedure was not followed creating issues of constantly hearing the dinging of an elevator. Second the heating and cooling unit in my room was extremely loud and the temperature sensor is way off. 72 or 70 degrees felt like 65 and would keep the loud unit on all the time which is not good for sleep. Setting the unit to an ever warmer temp meant that it was quiet but I awoke to a warm room at 330 AM. It was a lose lose situation. As for the room it was average to a bit dated and very poorly lit. That did not make it easy to do work in the morning.

WHAT I LIKED BEST WAS MY RECOLLECTION OF WHAT A NICE HOTEL IT ONCE WAS. NOW IT IS SHABBY UNKEMPT AGING LIKE MY GRAMMA. THE LOBBY USED TO FEEL BUSTLING AND INTERNATIONAL WITH THE FLIGHTS AT OHARE POSTED. THE BAR USED TO BE BUSY WITH CONVIVIALITYNO MORE. THE WELLNESS CENTER IS INCREDIBLY UNDER FURNISHED THEY COULD LEARN FROM THE MARIOT ON MICHIGAN. TAKE A GANDER AT WHAT FITNESS CAN LOOK LIKE. MY STAY WAS A RETROSPECTIVE OF WHAT THE PLACE WAS LIKE LAST CENTURY. EVEN WORSE HOTEL EMPLOYEE IS GONE.

Great location and top notch accommodations. I ’ve stayed here a couple of times and all of them have been a great experience. The location is great for anything you want to do in the city. As well as the people that work there are always nice and accommodating to my various request. Gym is better then most hotels and restaurant is very good as well.
Wo n’t stay again. Poor service horrible horrible horrible elevators lost power in our room twice unfriendly.

Great location with a friendly front desk but the elevators can be a bit slow depending on the time of day. Included gym with standard equipment and full set of weights was welcome rooftop pool was closed for the season unfortunately with no indoor pool.
You can not find any other hotel with better accommodation for their rates.

Comfortable and a good price. Lovely renovations still underway. Modernization and updating well done. Location easy for restaurants shopping. Very good value for area. Could use more staff at checkin desk. Lobby staff could be friendlier warmer.

The property is in good location but we did not get the King bed requested. They did n’t have any more available which was very frustrating. Then we were told they could upgrade us for additional 20. Additionally walls are thin. Located close to elevator and there was noise throughout night late.

Not happy with the service provided by this hotel for the price. Being a Silver rewards member I was not offered water or a Wifi password upon arrival. At check in no one was working the honors desk so used the regular desk. I was told at 430 PM that our room was not ready yet but they had a room that they could switch us to that was a lower level by the elevator that was a handicap accessible room. I took this room because we had just come from the beach and the whole family was waiting to take a shower. Went to the room and found no towels in the room. Called multiple times to have towels brought to the room and this never happened during our stay.
Pleasant. Excellent location. Room facilities were basic. Staff need t show a little more care and attention.

Very dirty hotel. We are very disappointed with this hotel. Unfortunately we are still here. We arrived and went to our room. The room 1012 was filthy. There was a French fry on the floor slightly under the bedside table which must have been obvious to the cleaner. Rice and other bits of food under the desk. Dust everywhere. We ran our fingers through the dust. Nasty stains on the floor walls and curtains. The air conditioner is full of dust which is a health hazard and my husband has COPD amongst other health problems. We went to reception and talked to Alex who apologised and immediately moved us. The new room 603 is cleaner but still leaves a lot to be desired. The air conditioner here is also throwing dust around the room which is not healthy. We have now been here for 24 hours and the packet of sugar on the 6th floor in the hall is still there along with bits of paper. They do n’t vacuum the halls. On the 10th floor a coat hanger was lying there for anyone to walk over. This place is a health hazard. A real problem in hot weather when you ca n’t use the air conditioner which smells of dust when you use it. Above the bed frame is a thick layer of dust that must have been there for months. I advise everyone not to stay here. There was a used band aid lying on the ground in the pool area. This was fairly early in the morning when not many people were there so it was probably left from the day before. Unfortunately we are booked in until Wednesday.

Jerome in Housekeing and the Location. JEROME IN HOUSEKEEPING IS AMAZING. He was SO helpful and so kind. He was very knowledgeable about the area and so easy to talk to. Anything we needed I just had to ask for Jerome and he made it happen with a smile on his face. He went above and beyond and with his giving spirit it seems like that ’s the kind of thing he does all the time. He brought us fresh towels and told us information about the hotel that we did n’t get from the front desk such as the pool times and location. He really made my trip. I would stay in this hotel every time I go to a Chicago if I could be on his floor. Not to mention the fact that hallway did n’t have a spec of dusk on it. The rest of the hotel was also nice. It was clean and quite friendly. We did n’t really need a lot of things and did n’t accept housekeeping because we did n’t want them to have to deal with our clothes all over the place haha. But the pool was convenient and the location was the best part about the hotel. We could walk wherever we wanted to go. 20 minute walk from the Bean 10 minute walk to the pier and well within range of plenty of grocery stores Whole Foods clothing stores and other cute shops. I loved staying at this hotel.

Where do I start our room was n’t ready when we got there. The front desk staff was pretty indifferent about it. There ’s a “ complimentary water station ” in the room but there was no water. It was supposed to be given to us at check in. When calling the operator to ask for some they had no idea what I was talking about had to go back down to the lobby. Our room was nice clean and had a workout station however it had some water spots forming. AND the worst of it was the shower head was too big for the shower. If you were n’t extremely careful and diligent the floor would flood. Our toilet would barely flush and there was no fan in the bathroom to ventilate. The AC unit was so loud and it vibrated the bed. The WiFi was so bad slow we did n’t even bother using it. we were on the 5th floor. The floor vents. in the lobby are sharp and dangerous i cut my foot on one.

I told Ayana when we checked in I was a light sleeper and asked to be away from the elevator. She kindly obliged but the heater in our room rattled very loudly all night long. I have taken audio of the sound. In addition the toilet bowl was not cleaned properly as there were small pieces of feces stuck inside the bowl. We did not get into our room until late the day of our stay and had tickets to an event so did not ask for the bath to be cleaned and did not realize the heater was so loud until we returned to our room late in the evening. It is hard to believe the guests who had the room before us did not mention the loud heater. While the room size was gracious and the hotel is well located we were disappointed in our stay.

Our flight got cancelled and we came back to the city to stay one more night and have dinner with my son. The staff could not have been nicer and more welcoming. They greeted us as Hilton Honors members very kind professional making us feel important. They were accommodating and helpful since the airlines kept our luggage. Got us the necessary toiletries and asked what else they could do to assist. They even texted us as soon as we got to the room to make sure everything was alright. I had just checked out earlier from another hotel that I was totally dissatisfied with. Thank you DoubleTree for getting it right. I will definitely be back.
Worst experience ever. Scaming scoundrels with sup par accommodations.
